dmca.title: [EV1-C1795238E] FWD: Re: Infringement of Copyright - Piano on the Net
dmca.body:
We already went through this once! Your attorney, Andrea Almeida, called me and has in hand an updated version of this infringement notice with all the information needed to comply with the submission of this notice. Why are you sending me this again? This is very frustrating! Please update me on the status of this. I've attached the revised infringement notice once again! This is my third request for an update and a request for your plan of action. Who is the manager in charge of this hosting facility? Clint Clark On 11/15/06, Copyright wrote: > > To Whom It May Concern: > > Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not > substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital > Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA"). > > Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your > claim. > > Please visit our web site at www.ev1servers.net/About/dmca.aspx > > Legal Response Team > > -----Original Message----- > From: abuse@ev1.net [mailto:abuse@ev1.net] > Posted At: Monday, November 13, 2006 2:48 AM > Posted To: DMCA > Conversation: [EV1-C1795238E] FWD: Re: Infringement of Copyright - Piano > on the Net > Subject: [EV1-C1795238E] FWD: Re: Infringement of Copyright - Piano on the > Net > > > ==== Forwarded Ticket ==== > 1. FWD: Re: Infringement of Copyright - Piano on the Net Added by system > at Monday, Nov 13 2006 08:33 am > X-MailFrom: customerservice@ev1.net > X-RcptTo: abacus@abacus.ev1servers.net > Received: from [172.16.220.212] by [216.12.192.78] (abacus) for < > abacus@abacus.ev1servers.net>; Mon Nov 13 08:32:29 2006 > Received: from Exchanger.ev1servers.net ([207.218.222.101]) by > MAILCORE.THEPLANET.COM with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); > Mon, 13 Nov 2006 08:29:10 -0600 > Received: from mailin.ev1servers.net ([207.218.222.124]) by > Exchanger.ev1servers.net with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); > Mon, 13 Nov 2006 08:29:09 -0600 > X-ASG-Debug-ID: 1163428149-2105-242-0 > X-Barracuda-URL: http://207.218.222.124:8000/cgi-bin/mark.cgi > X-ASG-Recipient-Whitelist: abuse@ev1servers.net > Received: from mail.ev1.net (plainmail9.ev1.net [207.218.192.115]) by > mailin.ev1servers.net (Spam Firewall) with ESMTP id C4FF82DDC7 for < > abuse@ev1servers.net>; Mon, 13 Nov 2006 08:29:09 -0600 (CST) > Received: from SMTP32-FWD by mail.ev1.net > (SMTP32) id A0000033C; Mon, 13 Nov 2006 08:27:37 -0600 > Date: Mon, 13 Nov 2006 08:27:37 -0600 > Message-Id: <200611130827.AA28246058@mail.ev1.net> > Mime-Version: 1.0 > Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1 > Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable > From: "EV1.net Customer Service" > Reply-To: > X-Sender: > To: > X-ASG-Orig-Subj: FWD: Re: Infringement of Copyright - Piano on the Net > Subject: FWD: Re: Infringement of Copyright - Piano on the Net > X-Mailer: > X-Virus-Scanned: by Barracuda Spam Firewall at ev1servers.net > X-Barracuda-Spam-Score: 0.00 > X-Barracuda-Spam-Status: No, SCORE=0.00 using global scores of TAG_LEVEL= > 4.0 QUARANTINE_LEVEL=1000.0 KILL_LEVEL=8.0 WHITELISTED > Return-Path: customerservice@ev1.net > X-OriginalArrivalTime: 13 Nov 2006 14:29:09.0857 (UTC) > FILETIME=[152EED10:01C70730] > > MIME element (text/plain) > The following guy has not has a response from ya'll at all and it has been > over 2 weeks. He would very much appriciate a response from someone if > anything just to say ya'll are looking in to it. > > Thanks so much > > ---------- Original Message ---------------------------------- > From: Clint Clark > Reply-To: clint.clark.email@gmail.com > Date: Sat, 11 Nov 2006 23:55:05 -0600 > > > > > > > face="Arial">Christina,

I have not heard back from anyone since I > sent the updated copyright infringement notice to Andrea 2 weeks ago.
>
What is the status on this?

Thanks.


Clint > Clark




EV1.net Customer Service > wrote: >
> 
I recieved your prior letter you put in this one and I
> fowarded it over to the abuse department. They now have 2 copies of it and
> they should get this taken care of asap.
>
> Thanks,
> Christina D
> EV1
>
> ---------- Original Message ----------------------------------
> From: "Clint Clark" 
> Reply-To: 
> Date: Fri, 27 Oct 2006 08:04:12 -0500
>
> Swami Rajesh Chopra,
>
> Since you have ignored my requests over the past few years to remove my
> copyrighted material from your website, I have contacted your hosting
> provider (Everyones Internet). Their "Acceptable Use Policy" is clear when
> it comes to copyright infringement:
>
> 
> http://www.ev1.net/english/about/aup.asp
>
> "16. Infringement of Copyright, Patent, Trademark, Trade Secret, or
> Intellectual Property Right: Use of the EV1(r) service to transmit any
> material (by e-mail, uploading, posting, hot linking, directly linking or
> otherwise) that infringes any copyright, trademark, patent, trade secret
> or other proprietary rights of any third party, including, but not limited
> to, the unauthorized copying of copyrighted material, the digitization and
> distribution of photographs from magazines, books, or other copyrighted
> sources, and the unauthorized transmittal of copyrighted software."
>
> Here is what I sent them:
>
> --------
> Dear Everyones Internet, Robert Marsh, Roy Marsh III, and Randy Williams,
>
> One of your hosting-account customers,
>
> Swami Rajesh Chopra (Domain: www.liveindia.com - IP Address: 66.98.156.58
> ),
>
> has stolen almost an entire website's content and republished it on your
> server.
>
> Beginning on his page:
>
> 
> http://www.liveindia.com/piano/index.html
>
> He has stolen the content (beginning) from:
>
> 
> http://www.pianonanny.com/1.html
>
> If you page through his content, and then page through the Piano on the
> Net content, you will see that he has stolen almost the entire website known
> as PianoNanny.com's --Piano on the Net.  Piano on the Net is located at:
> 
> http://www.pianonanny.com/
>
> Piano on the Net has won many awards and has been featured on the NBC
> Nightly News (June 1998), CNN (October 1997), and in WebMaster (now CIO)
> Magazine (August 1997).
>
> I have tried to contact him several times, but he refuses to answer.
>
> Since he is hosting this stolen content on your servers, I was hoping you
> would be able to contact him and talk to him about removing it from your
> servers.
>
> Your help in this matter would be greatly appreciated.
>
> I thought a "Swami" was supposed to be a holy man? I guess you don't have
> to be an honest holy man if you're from India.
>
> Thank you.
>
>
> Sincerely,
>
>
> Clint Clark
> Author and owner of Piano on the Net
> --------
>
>
>
> Please remove my copyrighted material from your website! This is your
> final
> warning!
>
> We will take action against you.
>
> 
> http://www.loriswebs.com/stop-stolen-content.html
>
>
> Chopra, Rajesh
> Live India Internet Services
> 85, Suvidha Kunj, Pok, H-4&5,
> Pitampura,
> New Delhi, Delhi 110034
> IN
>
> +91-9810058383 fax: +91-11-23868383
>
> 
> liveindia@gmail.com
> 
> liveindia83@yahoo.com
>
>
>
> Clint Clark
> Author and owner of Piano on the Net
> Web Designer /Consultant
> The Art Department
> clint.clark.email@gmail.com
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
> > > > > > > > -- Clint Clark Web Designer /Consultant The Art Department www.pianonanny.com/portfolio/ clint.clark.email@gmail.com
